Description: St Sebastian set in a title border with vine and putti; St Sebastian wearing a loin cloth and tied to a tree, surrounded by five putti who are removing the arrows from his arms and legs and untying him. The title border with putti climbing vine, playing musical instruments and pulling a cart. 1512 and 1515 Woodcut
Producer name: Print made by: Hans Baldung (St Sebastian)
Curator's comments: For the St Sebastian see curator's comment for 1851,0208.318. There is another impression of the title border with Schäufelein's 'Rest on the flight to Egypt'. Acc. to Dodgson, this is the original block which contained both title border and illustration. The combination with the St Sebastian is therefore termed the 2nd state by Dodgson.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (129) (Baldung)
Dodgson 1903, 1911 / Catalogue of Early German and Flemish Woodcuts in the BM, 2 vols (II.32.85a)
